main event: On March 25, 1956, a UFO sighting was reported in Cincinnati, Ohio, involving a round object with no light that was standing still.
interesting points: The sighting was reported as ground-radar observation, indicating it was detected by radar from the ground.
The report states that there was insufficient data for analysis and evaluation, suggesting a lack of concrete evidence.
The object was described as round with no light and standing still, providing specific details about the UFO.
The location of the sighting was in the vicinity of Lunken Airport or Fort Thomas in Cincinnati, Ohio, adding a specific geographical reference.
The document includes various codes and technical details, reflecting the thoroughness of the military investigation into the sighting.
sighted object: round object with no light standing still
